Method Detail

setLightWeight

public void setLightWeight(boolean lightWeight)
Determines whether the most memory intensive attributes of this object (the 2d array of MandelPoints and the two BufferedImage s) should be discarded to save memory. Any method accessing one of the possibly discarded attributes should call setLightWeight(false) to ensure the values are recalculated if necessary. Since objects are constructed in the lightweight state, most of their state is lazy evaluated.

Parameters:
lightWeight -

calcLightWeightAttributes

public void calcLightWeightAttributes()
Calculates, and stores, values for light-weight attributes. This may be necessary because the object has just been constructed or because it was set to a light-weight state (presumably to reduce memory requirements).

toZoomedCanvas

public MandelCanvas toZoomedCanvas(ImageRegion screenSelection)
Given a selected area on this canvas, returns a new MandelCanvas bounded by that selection.

screenSelection -
Returns:

pointToCoordinates

public ComplexNumber pointToCoordinates(Pixel pixel)

getDisplayedBufferedImage

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getDisplayedBufferedImage(ImageSize requestedDisplayImageSize)
Accessor for the image object which should be displayed to user (not the image for saving). If this object is in a lightweight state then it will be fully evaluated (taken out of lightweight state) first. If the size of the attribute displayImage has changed, the returned image will first be updated to match the new size.

Parameters:
requestedDisplayImageSize -
Returns:

getLogicalBufferedImage

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getLogicalBufferedImage()
Accessor for the image with a one-to-one correspondence between pixels and the MandelPoint objects upon which the images are based. This is the image that can be saved to disk and serves as the basis for the scaled version displayed to the user.

Returns:

initLogicalBufferedImageColumn

public void initLogicalBufferedImageColumn(int column)
Sets the color for each pixel in the logical image.

Parameters:
column -

getColumnCount

public int getColumnCount()
Returns:
number of pixels comprising the x (real) axis.

getIterationMax

public int getIterationMax()
Returns:
last value for how many iterations a pixel is allowed before it a prisoner point if it did not pass the escape radius.

setIterationMax

public void setIterationMax(int iterationMax)
Setter. Since the logical image is dependent on this attribute, and the displayed image on the logical image, a change requires recalculating both.

Parameters:
iterationMax -

getLogicalImageSize

public ImageSize getLogicalImageSize()
Returns:

increaseIterationMax

public void increaseIterationMax()
Rather than having the user specify a new value for iteration max, this method increases it using a predefined formula. TODO: more intelligent increasing strategy; when that is done, use it to automatically increase iteration max everytime the image is zoomed.

setPalette

public void setPalette(java.lang.String name)
Both logical and displayed images are based on a coloring scheme. This method allows a new scheme to be indicated and updates both images.

Parameters:
name -

The palette which determined coloring of the currently set logical and display images.

Returns:

getDelta

public double getDelta()
Distance between two vertically or horizontally adjacent complex numbers quantized to match the pixelation of the logical image, assuming aspect ratio has been enforced and these distances are equal, if not: then the average of the two.

Returns:
